data.sentence: The word إِلَى comes from the root ا ل ي and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Hell or Hell-fire, name of the fire with which GOD will punish in the life to come, proper name of the abode of punishment.
data.sentence: The word جَهَنَّمَ comes from the root ج ه ن م and is associated with the meanings: Hell or Hell-fire, name of the fire with which GOD will punish in the life to come, proper name of the abode of punishment.
The word الْمُجْرِمِينَ comes from the root ج ر م and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to drive/impel/urge. yusaquna - they are driven or led. saiqun - driver. suq (pl. aswaq) - market, stem, leg, kashafat an saqaiha (27:44) is a well known Arabic idiom meaning to become prepared to meet the difficulty or to become perturbed/perplexed or taken aback, the literal meaning is "she uncovered and bared her shanks". yukshafu an saqin (68:42) means ther eis severe affliction and the truth laid here, it is indicative of a grievous and terrible calamity and difficulty. masaq - the act of driving.
data.sentence: The word وَنَسُوقُ comes from the root س و ق and is associated with the meanings: to drive/impel/urge. yusaquna - they are driven or led. saiqun - driver. suq (pl. aswaq) - market, stem, leg, kashafat an saqaiha (27:44) is a well known Arabic idiom meaning to become prepared to meet the difficulty or to become perturbed/perplexed or taken aback, the literal meaning is "she uncovered and bared her shanks". yukshafu an saqin (68:42) means ther eis severe affliction and the truth laid here, it is indicative of a grievous and terrible calamity and difficulty. masaq - the act of driving.

data.meanings: to be present, arrive at (any water to drink), go down into, draw near to (a place).
data.sentence: The word وِرْدًا comes from the root و ر د and is associated with the meanings: to be present, arrive at (any water to drink), go down into, draw near to (a place).
